body.name: Glorto GeForce GT 210 1024 MB DDR3 Low Profile Graphics Card, PCI Express 1.0 x16, Entry Level GPU for PC, SFF and HTPC (HDMI/VGA)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 15 hrs 39 mins
features: Powered by NVIDIA GeForce GT 210, 40nm chipset process with 589MHz core frequency
Integrated with 1024MB DDR3 memory and 64-bit bus width
Features double screen output by HDMI / VGA. HDMI Max Resolution-2560x1600, VGA Max Resolution-2048x1536
Original half height bracket matches with the low profile brackets make the Glorto GeForce GT 210 graphics card fit well with all PC tower, small form factor and HTPC(except micro form factor)
body.description: NVIDIA GeForce GT 210 1GB DDR3 64 Bit PCI Express 1.0 x 16 Low Profile Video Card Low noise and silent work, lower temperature and higher efficiency With 1024MB of memory capacity, this graphics card can meet the demands of home entertainment, light gaming, and office tasks. Offers VGA and HDMI interfaces, making the video card easy to connect different types of displays. The VGA interface is suitable for analog signals and the HDMI interface supports high-definition video transmission.Features a half-height low-profile design that making it compatible with various computer cases, especially SFF tower match with the included brackets.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 5.0 5.0 out of 5 stars 2 ratings 5.0 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The Glorto GeForce GT 210 Low Profile Graphics Card boosts computer experience faster than Integrated Graphics. The silent graphic card, with its super-quick GPU, or graphic processing unit, allows for playback of high-definition movies and making regular movies look HD. Featuring enhanced video processing power, the GT 210 graphic card converts and edits home movies and videos faster, enabling quicker uploads and a better viewing experience. Additionally, the card features a 64-bit memory interface and complete integrated support for HDMI, deep color and 7.1-channel digital surround sound. Plus, it provides stunning graphics with its 16 processing cores and offers a more enjoyable gaming experience. The Glorto silent graphic card enhances real-world applications and runs newer games and games in 3D games more efficiently and faster. The quiet feature and lightning speed makes for an indispensable addition to your computer experience.

NVIDIA GeForce GT 210 1GB DDR3 64 Bit PCI Express 1.0 x 16 Low Profile Video Card Low noise and silent work, lower temperature and higher efficiency With 1024MB of memory capacity, this graphics card can meet the demands of home entertainment, light gaming, and office tasks. Offers VGA and HDMI interfaces, making the video card easy to connect different types of displays. The VGA interface is suitable for analog signals and the HDMI interface supports high-definition video transmission.Features a half-height low-profile design that making it compatible with various computer cases, especially SFF tower match with the included brackets. What You Will Get: Glorto GeForce GT 210 1GB Graphics Card x1 Low Profile Brackets x1
What Glorto GeForce GT 210 Can Do: Dual Screen Display Picture&Video Editing Office Working

Specification GPU Name GT218 Memory Format 1GB DDR3 64 bits Ports HDMI / VGA CUDA Core 16 GPU Clock 589 MHz Memory Clock 500 MHz Shader Clock 1402 MHz Slot PCI Express x16 1.1 DirectX Support DirectX 10.1 Maximum Digital Resolution 2560x1600 Computing OpenCL/ DirectCompute Technologies OpenGL 3.3

Troubleshooting Tips The following troubleshooting tips may help if you experience problems. Contact GLORTO for more advanced troubleshooting information. Check that the card is seated properly in the PCI Express slot.Ensure that the display cable is securely fastened to the card's display connector.Make sure that the monitor and computer are plugged in and receiving power.If necessary, disable any built-in graphics capabilities on your motherboard. For more information, consult your computer's manual or manufacturer. (NOTE: Some manufacturers do not allow the built-in graphics to be disabled or to become the secondary display.)Make sure you selected the appropriate display device and graphics card when you install the graphics driver.Restart your computer. Press on your keyboard after system starts up. When the Windows Advanced Options Menu appears, select Safe Mode and press . After getting into Safe Mode, in Device Manager check whether the driver for the graphics card is correct.If you are not able to find the desired monitor color/resolution settings: The color and screen resolution options available for selection depend on the graphics card being installed. If necessary, adjust your monitor's setting using monitor's adjust panel to make the screen look focused, crisp, and sharp. (Please refer to the monitor's manual.)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality for the price
reviews.reviewText: Installed this video card in my older Windows 10 desktop machine because I wanted dual monitors. Both the HDMI and VGA ports work well with crisp displays. For the price it will breathe new life into my older machine.I don't use it for gaming and can't speak to its performance in a high GPU requirement application. It suits my needs for browsing, email, and financial applications.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better then the 4090
reviews.reviewText: Bought this to replace my rtx 3070 and it blows it away. I even got to run street racing syndicate max settings and only crashed once. No GPU better than this one. Recommend only to extreme gamers ready for some serious performance. Best GPU ever. Would have given 10 starts if could.
